snippet: The heads of the European Union's member states appeared to be taking advantage of the relative calm in markets to put off more moves toward integration.
abstract: Leaders of the European Union's member states appear to be taking advantage of the relative calm in markets to put off moves toward integration, coming closer to setting up common banking rules for the bloc, but delaying plans for a shared budget.

byline.contributor: David Jolly contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The heads of the European Union's member states appeared to be taking advantage of the relative calm in markets to put off more moves toward integration.

headline.seo: European Leaders Back Common Banking Rules
headline.main: European Leaders Back Common Banking Rules
headline.print_headline: European Leaders Back Common Banking Rules
